title: Steph Roberts HW1
description: Using R to help determine how much food to make
contents:
Potluck brainstorming
The office is having a potluck. There are 40 people in the office. One box of cupcakes makes 24 servings. How many boxes of cake mix are needed?


40/24


[1] 1.666667

It looks like we will need more than 1.6 boxes. To ensure eveyone gets a cupcake, 2 full cake mixes are needed.


24*2


[1] 48

Two cake mixes will make 48 cupcakes. That means we will have extra for people to have seconds if they like.


48-40


[1] 8

There will be 8 extra cupcakes.
Two cakes mixes will be perfect!

title: HW1
contents:
R basics


x <- seq(from=10, to=30, by=5)
5*x


[1]  50  75 100 125 150

y <- c(12,543,2,"my_test")
paste(y,"abc",sep="_")


[1] "12_abc"      "543_abc"     "2_abc"       "my_test_abc"

z <- 12
w <- 144
w/z


[1] 12

Data exploration
mtcars


library(tidyverse)
t <- head(select(mtcars, mpg, cyl))
table(t)


      cyl
mpg    4 6 8
  18.1 0 1 0
  18.7 0 0 1
  21   0 2 0
  21.4 0 1 0
  22.8 1 0 0

Orange


dim(Orange)


[1] 35  3

colnames(Orange)


[1] "Tree"          "age"           "circumference"

summary(Orange)


 Tree       age         circumference  
 3:7   Min.   : 118.0   Min.   : 30.0  
 1:7   1st Qu.: 484.0   1st Qu.: 65.5  
 5:7   Median :1004.0   Median :115.0

       Max.   :1582.0   Max.   :214.0  

Plotting

title: Ruth HW1
description: This is my test post to Rpubs
contents:
library(distill)
library(knitr)
library(tidyverse)
library(meta)
library(dplyr)
library(broom)
library(ggplot2)
library(rio)

Therapy <- import("MSWdata.sav")





ggplot(Therapy, aes(x="EMDR1"))+
  geom_histogram(stat="count", binwidth = 1)

title: HW 1
contents:
2 + 5 == 3


[1] FALSE



16 / 3


[1] 5.333333



6 <= 9


[1] TRUE



FirtTerm_score <- c(83,55,90,99,46,66) 
FirtTerm_score/100


[1] 0.83 0.55 0.90 0.99 0.46 0.66

student_name <- c("Apple","Susan","Nancy","Linda","Sam","Noah")





score <- data.frame(student_name,FirtTerm_score)
head(score)


  student_name FirtTerm_score
1        Apple             83
2        Susan             55
3        Nancy             90
4        Linda             99
5          Sam             46
6         Noah             66
